{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28468].
  {panel}

At current point, the mentions function in JIRA requires the fundamentals to work, which are:
* User must have the "Browse User" permission.
* The comments and/or description fields must be in the Wiki Text Renderer format.

However, if the *User email visibility* property in JIRA's General Configuration page is set to "Hidden", then this would break the mentions feature as well.

This has been highlighted as a knowledge base article here: [Mentions are Not Working in JIRA 5.x|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Mentions+are+Not+Working+in+JIRA+5.x]

It would be great if the mentions feature is bounded to just the user's username and full name, just like Confluence.
fields.summary: Improve Mention Function to Exclude Email Address

fields.description:
1. Go to Issue Navigator where you have lists of issues.
2. Go to the issue at the bottom >> Click 'Action' button >> Assign Issue to Someone.

This issue is *not* reproducible in JIRA 4.2.4.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28466].
  {panel}

The custom field "Custom_A" whose available context is 7 issue types (not all issue types). The custom field is available for at least one of the projects

The project "Project_A" has 9 issue types, 7 of which are standard issue type (those that have the custom field "Custom_A"), and 2 that are sub-tasks.

When I do a search in the issue navigator, if I select the project "Project_A" and select some or all of the standard issue types and search, under Custom Fields there is a drop down box for "Custom_A".

However, if I select the project "Project_A" and "Standard Issue Types" the field "Custom_A" is not available. It seems that the "Standard Issue Types" option is not parsed correctly. I would expect it would "check" all standard issue types for this project. Instead it makes a check on all standard issue types on global server, causing the custom field to not pop-up as an search option.



As a work-around I've selected the custom field to be used by all issue types. Still this looks like something that needs to be resolved.
fields.summary: Missing custom field in issue navigator search criteria using the Standard Issue Types option

fields.description:
Do either of the following in BTF (WebSudo is disabled in OnDemand):

1) Create a new clean instance and complete setup.
2) Log in and go to the dashboard.
The Welcome Dialog pops up and invites you to create a project
3) Click the "Create a project" button.
You get the WebSudo login prompt.
4) Authenticate to WebSudo.
Instead of showing the "Add Project" dialog, it reloads the page and shows the welcome dialog again instead.

Or

1) Log in to an existing BTF instance.
2) Go to Administration.
3) Click "View All Projects"
4) Click the "Add Project" button
The WebSudo login prompt comes up.
5) Authenticate to WebSudo.
Instead of showign the "Add Project" dialog, it reloads the page and just shows the project listing again.

Affects 5.0.6 and 5.0.5 but not 5.0.3 or master.

Please check why this wasn't caught by the WebDriver tests, this is a pretty basic regression.
fields.summary: WebSudo prompt for "add project" doesn't redirect to "add project" dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28459].
  {panel}

CAC page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA050/__date+and+time+formats

Under *Configuring date picker formats*, on the *Preferred Date/Time* table you'll find on the second line the value of the {{jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format}} property:
* %b/%e/%y %I:%M %p

But, actually this is what was supposed to be:
* %m/%d/%y %I:%M %p

Because, according to the first table, the *MM/dd/yy* value it's equivalent to the format %m/%d/%y and not %b/%e/%y.

I have resolved an issue that the customer was following the documentation to configure his date picker and he was failed. Then, I found out that the value in the documentation were wrong. I asked him to use the right value and he was succeeded.
fields.summary: Value of the jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format property

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28458].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently JIRA seems not to be 100% compatible with the security rule specs defined in OWASP ModSecurity Core Rule Set (CRS).
 The rule set is not only used by apache mod_security, but also is used by a big number of content distribution network (CDNs) providers and also by major cloud service providers like Microsoft Azure Application Gateway web application firewall.
h3. Suggested Solution

Need to make JIRA more compatible with the OWASP WAF rule set: [https://coreruleset.org/faq/]
h3. Why this is important
 # Enterprise customers using CDNs and Cloud services such as MS Azure are more likely to enable OWASP WAF rules on their infrastructure, with JIRA not able to be 100% compatible, those rules will prevent many JIRA functionalities from working as expected.

Enforcing WAF rules is very useful for businesses as it makes their infrastructure more robust against attacks.
fields.summary: Improve JIRA compatibility with OWASP ModSecurity Core Rule Set (CRS)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28443].
  {panel}

*Summary of The Issue*

As describe on this documentation:

* [Adding a Custom Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+a+Custom+Field]

When creating custom fields the following option is provided:

* Bug Import Id
* Import Id

Both of those options have the same description which is

* Bug Import Id
A read-only custom field that points back to the previously imported bug id.
* Import Id
A read-only custom field that points back to the previously imported bug id.

Although both of those options have the same description, "Bug Import Id" have one important difference which is non-searchable. 

*Suggested Resolution*

* Deleting "*Bug Import Id*" from custom fields option
* Changing the custom fields description to the following
** *Bug Import Id*
A read-only, *non-searchable* custom field that points back to the previously imported bug id.
** *Import Id*
A read-only, *searchable* custom field that points back to the previously imported bug id.
fields.summary: "Bug Import ID" is redundant compared to "Import Id"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28437].
  {panel}

JIRA is an enterprise solution - can we please have to ability to specify custom validators/conditions and post functions?

Even with JIRA Toolkit, JIRA Suite Utilities and other common installed plugins, we are not able to do this.

E.g. if we wanted to restrict dates to only current/past dates, is there currently a validator for this?

It's also not possible to mark required fields - JIRA Suite Utilities can add this as a validator, but it's a major hack - it doesn't have the (*) and it shows ERROR in the logs. It's very confusing for end users.

What we need is at least basic functionality over this that is consistent and not functions from plugins here and there.

The current workaround is 3rd party plugins, e.g. Script Runner and/or Behaviour Plugin, but is a lot of work.

This applies especially to JIRA OnDemand due to the plugin policy.
fields.summary: Custom Validators/Conditions/Post Functions
Filter out issues in Road Map
Improve JIRA behaviour with NGINX proxy

fields.description:
When a user is present in more than one directory, once member of a specific group but only from the directory in the lowest priority, JIRA will count this user in the Group filter (_Administive > Users > Groups > Filtering the group > refer to the users counter_), but not recognize him as a member of ( _Administrative > Users > Groups > Filtering by the related group > Edit Members_)

*Steps to reproduce*

# Default JIRA installation creating a user called *jira_admin*
# Add two new users called *administrator* and *support*
# Check the {{jira-users}} group counter through _Administrative > Users > Groups > Filtering by the jira-users group > Refer to the Users column 
-- They are 3 (jira_admin, administrator, support)
# Confirm it by _Administrative > Users > Groups > Filtering by the jira-users group > Edit Members option
-- They are 3 (jira_admin, administrator, support)
# Create an external directory
-- AD (Type => Connector ; Operations/Mode => Read only with local groups ; Priority => 0)
# Synchronize it and try to login with *administrator* user (LDAP credentials)
# Review the related group counter and members
-- They are 3 (jira_admin, administrator, support)
# Log with jira_admin user and *remove the administrator from jira-users* group
# Check the related group counter, as well the members by Edit Members option

 The counter will be wrong (4, yet), as well the directory name from the administrator user. It will be displayed as *Internal directory*, even with LDAP memberships.
 Also, the member list will be right when checking against the Edit Members
fields.summary: Inconsistency on group counter when the same user exists in multiple directories

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce:

# In a JIRA instance with two user directories:
-- LDAP (Type => Connector; Operations/Mode => Read only with local groups; Position => 0)
-- Internal (Basic; Position => 1)
# Through JIRA web interface, create a group called *TestGroup*.
# Create a group using the same name into the LDAP.
# On LDAP side, add n user as member of the *TestGroup*.
# Resynchronize the LDAP directory within JIRA web interface.

h4. The result:
JIRA is not able to update the group membership and will log the following error during the synchronization:
{noformat}
28 21:50:58,176 QuartzWorker-0 DEBUG      [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] group [ TestGroup ] in directory [ 10000 ] matches local group of same name, skipping
{noformat}

h4. Workaround:
# copy all group memberships in the local directory to the external directory
# delete the group in the local directory
If you want to treat a select group of user specially in JIRA only:
# configure a new group with a similar but different name (e.g. TestGroupJIRA instead of TestGroup) and manage that group within JIRA

h4. Another workaround:

# Backup JIRA database.
# Run the following sql statement:
{code:sql}
UPDATE cwd_group SET local = 0 WHERE local = 1 AND group_name = 'TestGroup';
{code}
# Restart JIRA application.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28420].
  {panel}

h4. Actual behavior: 

JIRA is adding the _Catch Email Address_ as a Watcher of an Issue when the E-mail Address belongs to some JIRA User and the Mail Handler has *CC Watcher* enabled. Leading to a possible Mail Loop.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a Project and associate with the _Default Notification Scheme_;
# Add an Incoming Mail Server and Add a Mail Handler that has the CC Watcher enabled and set a _Catch Email Address_ the same as one JIRA User.
# Send an e-mail to that address.
# JIRA will create the issue and add the _Catch Email Address_ address as one of the watchers.

h4. Expected behavior:

JIRA should not add the user in the watchers list.

h4. Notes:
# This is affecting JIRA Service Desk Email Settings as well, in this case it is the request participants.
# Tested on JIRA Core 7.0.2 and without the "Catch Email Address". If there is a user with the same email address as in "To" of a sent email, it will added as a watcher.

h4. Workaround:

Modify the user email address or the Catch Email Address being used.
fields.summary: Catch Email Address added as a Watcher when CC Watcher is on

GreenHopper needs to run a fair few JQL queies and if the query is issue in filter(123) then the LOADING of the JQL is really slow.

This is hurting GH ability to map from issue ==> GH board.
fields.summary: Filters referenced in filters are slow to load in "override security" mode.

fields.description:
The message creating API is not clear, but that is exacerbated significantly by a poorly caught NPE.

If you call AttachmentManager.createAttachment(...) (and I suspect the same for the method on MessageHandlerContext.createAttachment(...) ) with a MutableIssue which has not yet been created, MutableIssue.getKey() is called and null is returned, but this value is not checked before being passed to the constructor of File(String, String).  This throws an NPE and causes the misleading (and incorrect) error message:

{code}
com.atlassian.jira.web.util.AttachmentException: Exception trying to establish attachment directory. Check that the application server and JIRA have permissions to write to it: java.lang.NullPointerException
{code}

I am not sure if this should be a feature request or a bug, but due to the erroneous nature of the message and the poorly handled NPE I'd err on the side of bug (but very minor one).

For details, see JSP-127687
fields.summary: When calling public API createAttachment with a MutableIssue not yet created, throws NPE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28411].
  {panel}

I have a problem with allowing people to convert the normal issue to subtask.

According to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/EHSP-29889, I got confirmation that the person who is able to do that must have *Edit Issue* permission. 

From my point of view, people who has the permission of creating issue may want organize the issue by themselves like converting their issue to subtask of the another issue, but they may not have permission of editing issue.

Therefore, please add more role or permission for covert the issue separately.
fields.summary: Please add more role or permission for convert the issue

fields.description:
Step to reproduce this issue : 
 # Install JIRA 
 # Go to Control Panel change your regional and language
  **  Format choose Thai 
  ** Location choose Thailand
 # Insert your valid license and proceed. 
 # Create user and password and proceed.

Error shown like below : 

!test.png!

When you click on 'Edit License or proceed under Evaluation Terms' and try to insert the License again error will be shown like below : 

!test3.png!


Expected : 

JIRA to run normally, and proceed to login page. 


Workaround : 

# Shut Down JIRA 
# Change to settings to English (United States, United Kingdom)
# Re-start JIRA 
# Login page appear and you can login with user you created during the Setup Wizard steps.

Note : Change back the Language to previous settings after things worked correctly in English setting will result the same issue after re-starting JIRA.

fields.description:
# Create a new workflow with just (i.e. click Add New Worklow and *NOT* copy): Created -> Open.
# Save the workflow.
# Assign the workflow to a project.
# Create a draft of the workflow and open in the WF designer.
# Add Resolved Step.
# Add Re-opened Step.
# Add a Transition Resolved -> Re-opened
# Add a transition Re-opened -> Resolved.
# Add a transition Resolved -> Open
# Publish the draft.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28392].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce (Scenario A)

* Setup a fresh installation of JIRA
* At the first step of the [set up wizard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA050/Running+the+Setup+Wizard], choose a language pack other than English such as German
* Finish the setup and create issues
* Go to the general configuration page and change the default language to English
* *(BUG)* The dashboard will still be mixed with both English and German language see screenshot

h3. How to reproduce (Scenario B)

* Start JIRA from a clean instance
* Create two users: One with the default language and one with a different locale than the system default (For example: Japanese or Spanish)
* Make sure that the system default locale is set to English(UK)
* Shutdown Jira and Restart
* Login into jira with the Japanese user
* Go to the dashboard. Make sure that the assigned to me gadget shows no issues assigned
* Login again with the default language user
* *(BUG)* Go to the dashboard, you will see the "No issues assigned" text in Japanese.

h3. Workaround

- Restart JIRA, or in JIRA Administration "Refresh Client Resources" (System> User Interface > Look and Feel) and make sure that the language of the first user to browse the JIRA dashboard gadgets is the same as the system's default language.

h3. Root Cause Analysis

This is caused by the way JIRA includes {{web-resources}} into the gadget's XML specification.

Currently, when JIRA is started all gadget specifications available in {{gadget}} plugin modules are retrieved, then we proceed to resolve a number of Atlassian specific directives (see https://developer.atlassian.com/display/GADGETS/Using+Substitution+Variables+and+Directives+in+your+Gadget) and then the transformed xml specification is validated and cached for later use.

At this stage, web resources are included via two of these directives, specifically {{#requireResource}} and {{#includeResources}}. This happens at {{GadgetProcessorImpl.processIncludeResources}} and web resource urls are generated per each included resource. The URl needs to include the locale as part of the resource to fetch, so since this is done at start-up this will be the system default language at that moment.

This is the wrong time to do this as: 

# All users will then get the cached transformed copy of the gadget spec xml which will specify inclusion of resources using the default language.
# If the language of the first user to request a gadget is not the system default language (used to resolve the urls to the included resources) any call to  {{AJS.getText()}} or soy's {{getText}} function will be done under the current user's language, which will then cause the included resources for the default language to be cached with i18n strings in the _wrong_ language. 

The second problem is more severe as it will affect any part of the UI that makes use of the resources corrupted with the i18n messages in the wrong language.
fields.summary: The language translation got mixed up in the dashboard after choosing a default language other than the chosen one from initialization

fields.description:
Project Import failed even with Plugin installed in both Source and Target Instance. 

*Step to reproduce the error:*
  # Install Greenhopper plugin on JIRA instance A using the UPM.
  # Install Greenhopper plugin with the same version on JIRA instance B using the UPM.
  #  Create a project X on instance A
  #  Backup instance A
  #  Delete project X from A
  #  Restore project X to JIRA instance B. It fails as shown in screenshot.

*This step will not reproduce the error:*
  # Install Greenhopper plugin on JIRA instance A using the UPM.
  # Install Greenhopper plugin with the same version on JIRA instance B using the UPM.
  #  *Restart JIRA instance A*
  #  Create a project Y on instance A
  #  Backup instance A
  #  Delete project Y from A
  #  Restore project Y to JIRA instance B. It succeeds.
 
This is tested in JIRA 5.0.3.
fields.summary: Project Import Fail With Error Requires Custom Field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28384].
  {panel}

Using a physical Kanban board with stickie-notes, eventually the stickie-notes will "decay" and fall off the board.  A great indication that the ticket has been sitting on the board for way too long, and obviously it wasn't important enough to become urgent.

What if JIRA had a similar "decay" feature, where you can configure the 'half-life' of different classifications of issues...and these items that have decayed, or became stale, fall into a pane on the bottom of your screen that you can drag open - similar to a pile of stickie-notes that have fallen onto the floor.

The neat thing about this is, if an item has been stuck in a state that isn't an "end-point" (closed, open, etc.), then the status changes to the stale status and can be found easily in the slide-out pane at the bottom of the window.

You could do really neat things with this as well, like run reports on how many items become stale; easily communicate a list of items that need to be triaged/addressed; and also you have a way to visualize the items that aren't getting any attention.

It's somewhat of a cheek feature, but I think there is value in being able to quickly/easily visualize the work that is being abandoned.  It will help the development teams so that the backlog doesn't get cluttered with items that never die...and it will help managers to make certain that items are walking through the process properly.

Let me know if you have any questions.
Thank you for building such awesome products!
-
Matt Terry
mcterry@sep.com
fields.summary: Request to add a new "decay" feature for JIRA issues...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-28379].
  {panel}

The OnDemand Importer has logic in {{StudioImporterFacade#postImportStudify()}} to massage freshly imported config data into the shape required by OnDemand environment.

If the import process fails after the data import but before this "post-import Studify" step, the instance configuration is corrupt, in such a way that customers cannot log in.

The workaround to re-enable access to customer admins is to correct the base URL, and manually ensure the Global Permissions refer to groups that exist on OnDemand (for example, replace {{jira-administrators}} with {{administrators}}). The customer admin may then re-run an import, and the instance should be OK if this second import completes successfully.

This seems to be rare, but the impact is severe. Failures I have seen that have caused this are:
- A badly timed PermGen exhaustion.
- The following exception (not sure what the underlying cause is):
{noformat}
2012-05-23 18:19:25,932 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR rfernandes 1098x7022x1 970isl 59.167.133.3,59.167.133.70 /secure/admin/StudioImport!import.jspa [jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.IllegalStateException: It is illegal to call the ServiceManager before all components are loaded. Please use interface com.atlassian.jira.extension.Startable to get notified when JIRA has started.
java.lang.IllegalStateException: It is illegal to call the ServiceManager before all components are loaded. Please use interface com.atlassian.jira.extension.Startable to get notified when JIRA has started.

      at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl.getServices(ConsistencyCheckImpl.java:170)

      at com.atlassian.jira.studio.importer.StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.call(StudioDataImportAsyncCommand.java:97)

fields.description:
While creating or editing *workflow name* and *workflow scheme name*, the following versions behave differently:

* JIRA 4.4.4 and JIRA 4.4.5 *allow both* the workflow name and workflow scheme name to be more than 30 characters

* JIRA 5.0 and 5.0.2 *DO NOT allow both* the workflow name and workflow scheme name to be more than 30 characters

* JIRA 5.0.3 and JIRA 5.0.4 *allow only the the workflow name* to be more than 30 characters, BUT, they *DO NOT allow the workflow scheme name* to be more that 30 characters.
fields.summary: Workflow name and workflow scheme name length varies in different versions
